name: Training Course in Conservation of Photographs in Museums, Archives, and Collections
description:
Don’t let history disappear–or discolour–or fade! Discover the science of photography conservation and learn the art of restoring historic photograph collections. This hands-on, intensive training course is designed for practising conservators, archivists and custodians of historic photograph collections to learn preventive collection care measures, remedial conservation processes, and restoration techniques.

This three month course will be followed by a one month internship. The course will be instructed by leading specialists from India and overseas and includes topics such as: 

 -Development, materials and techniques of historic photographic processes

 -Identification and understanding of deterioration processes in photograph collections

 -Inspection and survey methodologies

 -Condition report preparation and preservation prioritisation decisions

 -Emergency treatment measures

 -Conservation of film and glass plate negatives

 -Conservation and restoration of photographs

 -Archival protocols of housing, display, and storage of photographic materials

 -Disaster management

name: Ancient Board Games: A Blast from the Past!
description:
Image Credits: Ima reCreations

Some games never get old — and neither does the laughter they bring. Take a break from screens and rediscover the simple joy of games that once filled long afternoons and family evenings.

Bring your kids, parents, or that uncle who always claims he let you win at Pagade — and challenge them again! Try your hand at classics like Pallankuzhi, Thayam (5 or 7 mane), Goat and Tiger, Gilli Danda, and many more. Swap stories, share tips, and pass down a slice of your childhood while making brand new memories together. After all, some of the best moments happen when generations gather around a game board. Come roll the dice and let the good times play on!

Games You Can Play:
- Tower of Brahma
- Star Game
- Pallankuzhi / Alukuzhi mane
- Thayam 5 mane / 7 mane
- Pagade
- Goat and Tiger
- County Chess
- Alignment Strategy Game Navakangari
- Fox and Geese
- Alquer or Bhag Bakri

name: Textiles in Focus - A Hands-on Workshop in Archiving & Documenting
description:
Calling all design students, professionals and enthusiasts to take part in museum practices in textile documentation!

Join this full day hands-on workshop to learn about procedures for documenting textiles, an integral part of creating a complete archive and exhibition. You’ll be able to shadow and assist professionals from the Haveli team in the steps involving textile documentation including research, photographing, digitisation, cataloguing and writing, ending the day with a collaborative discussion on the collection.

Please note:

- Last date for registration: June 27, 2025

- Limited seats available. Selected participants will be notified by July 2, 2025

- This workshop, though created especially for students, is open to everyone

About Haveli 

Founded in the 1980s by Poornima Jain, Haveli was a pioneering boutique that celebrated the richness of Indian craftsmanship through timeless clothing and accessories. Blending traditional craft and studio techniques into contemporary design, the brand explored diverse silhouettes using hand-woven fabrics and materials deeply rooted in India’s heritage and philosophy of sustainable livelihoods.

Haveli at MAP

The present-day Haveli collection at MAP includes over 2,800 textile objects and 2,000 ephemera items, featuring costumes, accessories and home textiles from Asian and African craft traditions, design studio developments along with archival materials like printing blocks, design sheets, and student projects that document the workings of a textile and fashion design studio.

name: My Summer Storybook
description:
Is your child still reminiscing about their summer vacation? Help them relive their memories at our bookmaking workshop. Join Aishwarya Arumbakkam, one of the artists featured in the Vaanyerum Vizhuthugal exhibition, in making books! The workshop is tailored for children aged between 8 to 12, and guides them to make books based on the summer vacation they just had.

Parents can help children in collecting some of the images from recent, or favourite vacations. Once you register, we will share an email ID with you to share the images with us so we can get it printed for your child. Please arrive at least 45 minutes before the workshop begins.

All materials, except for the images, will be provided.

Please note: This workshop is only for children aged 8-12

name: All Hail The Trail
description:
This guided trail of the exhibition VISIBLE/INVISIBLE invites families to see familiar artworks with fresh eyes while exploring the hidden stories behind them. Along the way, you’ll play, hunt for details, and share thoughts and discoveries with each other — all through a hands-on trail designed to spark curiosity and conversation for all ages.

Slow down, look closer, and experience art not just by looking, but by connecting, asking, and imagining together. A fun way to bond as a family while making the galleries come alive!

name: Photo-(p)op: Strike a Pose, Make a Memory!
NeuroQueer BrainBox
description:
Visibility and representation in public spaces is important - especially for queer, neurodivergent Desis. That’s why the NeuroQueer Brain Box exists - a monthly group therapy space for Desi neurodivergent LGBTQIA+ people. Facilitated by Mani Agarwal, NeuroQueer Brain Box is a chance for Desi queer neurodivergent people to come together and work through their lived experiences using art.

Come and meet other LGBTQIA+ neurodivergent (ADHD/Autism/AuDHD) people who vibe with you.

Please note: This session is exclusively open to individuals from the LGBTQIA+ community

name: Family Day at MAP!
description:
Get ready for a day of laughter, discovery, and unforgettable memories at MAP's Family Day – a celebration of all the amazing people who make up your unique family!

Bring your kids, parents, grandparents, nieces, nephews, friends–whomever you call family. This is a chance to create unforgettable memories together, across generations. Whether you're young or old, there's curiosity, wisdom, and wonder to share at every age. It's all about having fun together, connecting, and sharing meaningful experiences as a family.

Join us at MAP for a day packed with captivating stories, thrilling games, and hands-on creative fun. You'll hear tales that bring artworks to life, embark on an exciting scavenger hunt, challenge yourselves with ancient board games, and unleash your creativity at our Make @ MAP workshop. And trust us, that's just the beginning – there's so much more waiting to surprise and delight you!

Wrap up your day with a cheerful theatre show and capture those perfect moments at our photo booth. So come on over, hit the slow-mo button, and let us handle all the fun!

Family Day Programmes:

- Ancient Board Games: A Blast from the Past!
- Make @ MAP: Craft Your Family Story!
- Photo-(p)op: Strike a Pose, Make a Memory!
- Scavenger Hunt: Museum-Wide Adventure!
- Storytelling with Vikram Sridhar: Stories Between the Lines
- Conversations That Matter
- All Hail The Trail

name: Storytelling with Vikram Sridhar: Stories Between the Lines
description:
Image Credit: Vikram Sridhar

In engaging 20-minute sessions, theatre artist Vikram Sridhar explores the cultural, personal, and historical layers woven into the labels and artefacts of Ticket Tika Chaap. Blending narrative and performance, Sridhar will embody a range of characters bringing forgotten voices and moments to life. Join us for an immersive experience that bridges theatre and storytelling, and leave with a deeper appreciation for the stories waiting to be discovered in the everyday.

name: Conversations That Matter
description:
Inspired by the evocative exhibition Vaanyerum Vizhuthugal: Roots that Reach for the Sky and guided by gentle prompts from our Art for Thought toolkit, we invite families to share wonderful stories, cherished memories, and quiet reflections – conversations you might not often find time for. It's the perfect opportunity to deepen your connections and maybe even discover new things about each other!

The Art for Thought toolkit is a reflective resource that uses artwork and thought-provoking prompts to spark meaningful conversations and self-discovery. Designed for all ages, it encourages mindful engagement with art to support emotional well-being and deeper dialogue

name: Make @ MAP: Craft Your Family Story!
description:
Who do you call family? Is it your kith and kin, a close-knit group of friends, a caring neighbour who feels like one of your own, or perhaps a loyal furry companion who’s always by your side?

Join us for a workshop that celebrates all the ways family can look and feel. In this hands-on session, you’ll get to craft popsicle puppets inspired by the people (and pets!) who make up your circle of love and care. Come, create, and carry home a tiny puppet family as unique and warm as your own!

Make @ MAP is a series that allows you to explore our collection in an engaging and hands-on manner. These sessions allow you to create and take home a special souvenir of your visit. It is perfect for all ages — so bring your friends and family and get ready to make some art! No experience is necessary, just a willingness to have fun and experiment with new materials.

name: Gossip After Hours: A Storytelling Workshop with Museum Objects
description:
Have you ever wondered what museum objects gossip about after closing time? Join this playful storytelling workshop to imagine conversations and other lives of artworks and artefacts at MAP. Together, we’ll craft stories that blur the lines between fact and fiction, inspired by the objects’ histories and your imagination. No writing experience needed - just curiosity and a love for stories! Come let your curiosity run wild!

Please Note:
- Limited seats are available. Deadline to register via Google Form: 24 June
- Selected participants will be notified by 25th June

name: Scavenger Hunt: Museum-Wide Adventure!
description:
Turn the museum into your playground with our lively scavenger hunt! Perfect for all ages, this adventure will lead you through galleries and hidden corners using clever clues and fun challenges. Solve riddles, spot details, and uncover secrets behind artworks as you race to the finish. Keep your eyes sharp — there’s a prize waiting for the winning team.

Gather your crew, follow the trail, and have fun!

Please note: There will be two sessions of this event

- 11:30 am to 12:30 pm

- 5:00 pm to 6:00 pm
